titles: A dyall of dayly contemplacion, or deuine exercise of the mind instructing vs to liue vnto God, and to dye vnto the vvorld. First colected & published in Latin, at the request of a godly Bishop, and Reuerent Father, Richard, sometime Byshop of Dirham, and Lorde Priuie Seale. Novv nevvly translated into Englishe, by Richard Robinson, citizen of London. Seene, and allowed.
author: Touris, William, attributed name.
Robinson, Richard, citizen of London.
publisher: By Hugh Singleton, dwelling in Creede Lane, at the signe of the gylden Tunne. Neare vnto Ludgate],
notes: Place of publication and printer's name and address from colophon.
A modernized version of: "Contemplacyon of synners", which is attributed to William Touris.
Reproduction of original in the University of Illinois (Urbana-Champaign Campus). Library.
keywords: Conduct of life --  Early works to 1800.
